45 def kfp_wml_pipeline(
46     GITHUB_TOKEN='',
47     CONFIG_FILE_URL='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/user/repository/branch/creds.ini',
48     train_code='tf-model.zip',
49     execution_command='\'python3 convolutional_network.py --trainImagesFile ${DATA_DIR}/train-images-idx3-ubyte.gz --trainLabelsFile ${DATA_DIR}/train-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz --testImagesFile ${DATA_DIR}/t10k-images-idx3-ubyte.gz --testLabelsFile ${DATA_DIR}/t10k-labels-idx1-ubyte.gz --learningRate 0.001 --trainingIters 20000\'',
50     framework='tensorflow',
51     framework_version='1.15',
52     runtime = 'python',
53     runtime_version='3.6',
54     run_definition = 'wml-tensorflow-definition',
55     run_name = 'wml-tensorflow-run',
56     model_name='wml-tensorflow-mnist',
57     scoring_payload='tf-mnist-test-payload.json',
58     compute_name='k80',
59     compute_nodes='1'
60 ):
61     # op1 - this operation will create the credentials as secrets to be used by other operations
62     get_configuration = configuration_op(
63                    token=GITHUB_TOKEN,
64                    url=CONFIG_FILE_URL,
65                    name=secret_name
66     )
67 
68     # op2 - this operation trains the model with the model codes and data saved in the cloud object store
69     wml_train = train_op(
70                    config=get_configuration.output,
71                    train_code=train_code,
72                    execution_command=execution_command,
73                    framework=framework,
74                    framework_version=framework_version,
75                    runtime=runtime,
76                    runtime_version=runtime_version,
77                    run_definition=run_definition,
78                    run_name=run_name,
79                    compute_name=compute_name,
80                    compute_nodes=compute_nodes
81                    ).apply(use_ai_pipeline_params(secret_name, image_pull_policy='Always'))
82 
83     # op3 - this operation stores the model trained above
84     wml_store = store_op(
85                    wml_train.outputs['run_uid'],
86                    model_name,
87                    framework=framework,
88                    framework_version=framework_version,
89                    runtime_version=runtime_version
90                    ).apply(use_ai_pipeline_params(secret_name, image_pull_policy='Always'))
91 
92     # op4 - this operation deploys the model to a web service and run scoring with the payload in the cloud object store
93     wml_deploy = deploy_op(
94                   wml_store.output,
95                   model_name,
96                   scoring_payload
97                   ).apply(use_ai_pipeline_params(secret_name, image_pull_policy='Always'))

16 def use_aws_secret(secret_name='aws-secret',
17                    aws_access_key_id_name='AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID',
18                    aws_secret_access_key_name='AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY',
19                    aws_region=None):
20     """An operator that configures the container to use AWS credentials.
21 
22     AWS doesn't create secret along with kubeflow deployment and it requires users
23     to manually create credential secret with proper permissions.
24 
25     ::
26 
27         apiVersion: v1
28         kind: Secret
29         metadata:
30           name: aws-secret
31         type: Opaque
32         data:
33           AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: BASE64_YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
34           AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: BASE64_YOUR_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
35     """
36 
37     def _use_aws_secret(task):
38         from kubernetes import client as k8s_client
39         task.container \
40             .add_env_variable(
41                 k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
42                     name='AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID',
43                     value_from=k8s_client.V1EnvVarSource(
44                         secret_key_ref=k8s_client.V1SecretKeySelector(
45                             name=secret_name,
46                             key=aws_access_key_id_name
47                         )
48                     )
49                 )
50             ) \
51             .add_env_variable(
52                 k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
53                     name='AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY',
54                     value_from=k8s_client.V1EnvVarSource(
55                         secret_key_ref=k8s_client.V1SecretKeySelector(
56                             name=secret_name,
57                             key=aws_secret_access_key_name
58                         )
59                     )
60                 )
61             )
62 
63         if aws_region:
64             task.container \
65                 .add_env_variable(
66                     k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
67                         name='AWS_REGION',
68                         value=aws_region
69                     )
70                 )
71         return task
72 
73     return _use_aws_secret

results.code:
15 
16 def use_azure_secret(secret_name='azcreds'):
17     """An operator that configures the container to use Azure user credentials.
18 
19     The azcreds secret is created as part of the kubeflow deployment that
20     stores the client ID and secrets for the kubeflow azure service principal.
21 
22     With this service principal, the container has a range of Azure APIs to access to.
23     """
24 
25     def _use_azure_secret(task):
26         from kubernetes import client as k8s_client
27         (task.container.add_env_variable(
28             k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
29                 name='AZ_SUBSCRIPTION_ID',
30                 value_from=k8s_client.V1EnvVarSource(
31                     secret_key_ref=k8s_client.V1SecretKeySelector(
32                         name=secret_name, key='AZ_SUBSCRIPTION_ID')))
33         ).add_env_variable(
34             k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
35                 name='AZ_TENANT_ID',
36                 value_from=k8s_client.V1EnvVarSource(
37                     secret_key_ref=k8s_client.V1SecretKeySelector(
38                         name=secret_name, key='AZ_TENANT_ID')))
39         ).add_env_variable(
40             k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
41                 name='AZ_CLIENT_ID',
42                 value_from=k8s_client.V1EnvVarSource(
43                     secret_key_ref=k8s_client.V1SecretKeySelector(
44                         name=secret_name, key='AZ_CLIENT_ID'))))
45          .add_env_variable(
46              k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
47                  name='AZ_CLIENT_SECRET',
48                  value_from=k8s_client.V1EnvVarSource(
49                      secret_key_ref=k8s_client.V1SecretKeySelector(
50                          name=secret_name, key='AZ_CLIENT_SECRET')))))
51         return task
52 
53     return _use_azure_secret

20 def use_gcp_secret(secret_name='user-gcp-sa',
21                    secret_file_path_in_volume=None,
22                    volume_name=None,
23                    secret_volume_mount_path='/secret/gcp-credentials'):
24     """An operator that configures the container to use GCP service account by
25     service account key stored in a Kubernetes secret.
26 
27     For cluster setup and alternatives to using service account key, check https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/authentication-pipelines/.
28     """
29 
30     # permitted values for secret_name = ['admin-gcp-sa', 'user-gcp-sa']
31     if secret_file_path_in_volume is None:
32         secret_file_path_in_volume = '/' + secret_name + '.json'
33 
34     if volume_name is None:
35         volume_name = 'gcp-credentials-' + secret_name
36 
37     else:
38         import warnings
39         warnings.warn(
40             'The volume_name parameter is deprecated and will be removed in next release. The volume names are now generated automatically.',
41             DeprecationWarning)
42 
43     def _use_gcp_secret(task):
44         from kubernetes import client as k8s_client
45         task = task.add_volume(
46             k8s_client.V1Volume(
47                 name=volume_name,
48                 secret=k8s_client.V1SecretVolumeSource(
49                     secret_name=secret_name,)))
50         task.container \
51             .add_volume_mount(
52                     k8s_client.V1VolumeMount(
53                         name=volume_name,
54                         mount_path=secret_volume_mount_path,
55                     )
56                 ) \
57             .add_env_variable(
58                 k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
59                     name='GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS',
60                     value=secret_volume_mount_path + secret_file_path_in_volume,
61                 )
62             ) \
63             .add_env_variable(
64                 k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
65                     name='CLOUDSDK_AUTH_CREDENTIAL_FILE_OVERRIDE',
66                     value=secret_volume_mount_path + secret_file_path_in_volume,
67                 )
68             ) # Set GCloud Credentials by using the env var override.
69         # TODO: Is there a better way for GCloud to pick up the credential?
70         return task
71 
72     return _use_gcp_secret
73

results.code:
37 
38 def use_k8s_secret(
39     secret_name: str = 'k8s-secret',
40     k8s_secret_key_to_env: Optional[Dict] = None,
41 ):
42     """An operator that configures the container to use k8s credentials.
43 
44     k8s_secret_key_to_env specifies a mapping from the name of the keys in the k8s secret to the name of the
45     environment variables where the values will be added.
46 
47     The secret needs to be deployed manually a priori.
48 
49     Example:
50         ::
51 
52             train = train_op(...)
53             train.apply(use_k8s_secret(secret_name='s3-secret',
54             k8s_secret_key_to_env={'secret_key': 'AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY'}))
55 
56         This will load the value in secret 's3-secret' at key 'secret_key' and source it as the environment variable
57         'AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY'. I.e. it will produce the following section on the pod:
58         env:
59         - name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
60           valueFrom:
61             secretKeyRef:
62               name: s3-secret
63               key: secret_key
64     """
65 
66     k8s_secret_key_to_env = k8s_secret_key_to_env or {}
67 
68     def _use_k8s_secret(task):
69         from kubernetes import client as k8s_client
70         for secret_key, env_var in k8s_secret_key_to_env.items():
71             task.container \
72                 .add_env_variable(
73                 k8s_client.V1EnvVar(
74                     name=env_var,
75                     value_from=k8s_client.V1EnvVarSource(
76                         secret_key_ref=k8s_client.V1SecretKeySelector(
77                             name=secret_name,
78                             key=secret_key
79                         )
80                     )
81                 )
82             )
83         return task
84 
85     return _use_k8s_secret
86
